intro: Argostemma borragineum var. rotundifolium, commonly known as the round-leaved argostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae, which includes many species with showy blue or purple flowers. The plant is characterized by its broad, rounded leaves and clusters of small, violet-colored flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
